column5: Anyone have an opinion on them? How do they stack up against Alumacraft?  Thinking of moving from my Alumacraft Magnum 165 tiller to a console.  Any thoughts appeciated.
Quality wise no comparision to what you have, keep the A boat
Alumacraft is much nicer and better built boat
Please let me know if you do change.
I've got a '94. Great boat.  Go get one.  Entropy
I've a 15' mirrorcraft tiller.  i think it's a 2000 or 2001 design. fine boat by me.  it's a 'deeper' vee than most i've seen in this size which makes it nice for chop.

i had a 2000 14` with a 30 hp mer  4 stroke  it was a great boat  belive it was called a troller  and it woudl size up to most 16    i would get it again  no issues with it .  Was moslty  used for downrigging on lake huron and g bay   strik
Was very close to buying a mirrocraft...very impressed with how sturdy, wide and deep they were (the model I saw, anyway).  Only passed on it because we got a better deal on a Smokercraft.
I have a 2000 18ft Mirrocraft Dual Impact Fish n Ski.  No issues so far.  I am pleased with the quality of the boat.  Sherriff
